image.altText: Zelenskyy and Trump walk side-by-side as Trump gives a lopsided grin

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says Russia will accept "security guarantees" for Ukraine after a White House meeting with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and major European leaders. Follow live.

title.children: Trump says Putin will accept 'security guarantees' on Ukraine

image.altText: A woman sitting in a child holding her phone.

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian childcare worker is facing allegations of sexually assaulting two children and grooming a foster child, an ABC investigation reveals.

title.children: Childcare worker accused of sexually assaulting children during nappy changes

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: Problem and productivity. It's a pairing that has become inseparable in recent times, given our productivity growth is the lowest in half a century.

title.children: Off the productivity round table: What won't be discussed this week

image.altText: Chalmers turns to walk away from a crowd of journalists at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers opens the much-anticipated productivity round table with an appeal for participants to seek consensus. Meanwhile, the NDIS has emerged as a key "structural issue" in the budget being eyed by the federal government for further reforms.

title.children: Productivity summit begins with a warning on NDIS spending

image.altText: worker smooths concrete at a slab pour with other workers in background.

props.synopsis: While the federal government insists its economic round table is more than just a talkfest, businesses are calling for a major reduction in red tape and excessive bureaucracy.

title.children: How red tape is leading to more expensive houses and sicker Australians, according to business

image.altText: Tourists taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: Spain could soon overtake France as the most visited country in the world and locals have had enough.

title.children: 'Go home': Country everyone wants to visit is turning on tourists

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses with a star of david pin

props.synopsis: As Australia and Israel trade visa cancellations, the far-right Israeli politician at the centre of the storm says Australia needs to choose between Israel and Hamas.

title.children: Israeli MP at centre of Australian visa row says choice is Israel or Hamas

image.altText: People hold umbrellas in cold wet windy weather

props.synopsis: Sydney's wettest August in nearly 30 years has tipped the city's recent climate into uncharted territory.

title.children: Sydney’s relentless rain now highest since weather station opened in 1858

image.altText: A woman sitting on the floor holding a sign saying 'Impeach, Convict, Remove'.

props.synopsis: Democrat-controlled California is moving ahead with its own redistricting plans aimed at neutralising the redrawing of US House seats in Republican-controlled Texas.

title.children: Texas Democrats return to state capitol after redistricting furore

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson stands in front of Qantas plane, holding a microphone

props.synopsis: Federal Court Justice Michael Lee has called out what many who have dealt with Qantas over a long period of time already know — that it's an "aggressive" company driven by greed, heavy on spin and light on the truth.

title.children: 'Performative remorse' costs Qantas $90m, as judge questions Hudson no-show

image.altText: Ethan Guo sits in the cockpit of a plane.

props.synopsis: The American pilot must leave Chile's Antarctic territory as soon as possible. But he can't use his plane to do so.

title.children: Chile wants teen pilot and influencer out of Antarctica but he says he's 'stuck' there

image.altText: Two men in suits standing in front of a sandstone building

props.synopsis: It's opening day for a new Tasmanian parliament — but before the dust settles, MPs will be asked to decide who should run the state. Here's what you need to know about the vote, the players and what happens next.

title.children: How today's no-confidence vote in Tasmania's parliament is likely to unfold

image.altText: Man in suit talking at a press conference

props.synopsis: With Labor's stubbornness to entertain any compromise to appease crossbenchers whose support it needed for today's vote in the Tasmanian parliament, it'll need all that hard-won backbone for another term on the Opposition benches.

title.children: With vote set to fail, Tasmanian Labor eyeing yet another term in opposition

image.altText: A police car in the foreground of a suburban street, with more police vehicles and staff further down the street.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after an infant was found dead in a stormwater drain in a street in Perth's north..

title.children: Infant found dead in stormwater drain in Perth

image.altText: A seismologist looks at an earthquake reading

props.synopsis: A magnitude-5.6 quake struck inland from the Sunshine Coast on Saturday morning, with tremors felt as far north as Rockhampton and as far south as Glen Innes in New South Wales.

title.children: Earthquakes are rare in Queensland, but can cause insurance challenges

image.altText: A young man with blond hair combed back, blue eyes and wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The prosecutor in charge of the case says Marius Borg Hoiby's membership of the royal family should not allow him to be treated more lightly.

title.children: Son of Norway crown princess charged with rape, dozens of other offences

image.altText: An entrance to a building

props.synopsis: A staffer at the Endeavour Hills Specialist School is charged with child sexual abuse offences, according to a letter sent to parents.

title.children: Staff member at Melbourne special school charged with child sex abuse

image.altText: Woman sits and looks at the camera with black background

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people shared personal stories with South Australia's royal commission into domestic, family and sexual violence. They hope it with lead to change. Warning: This story contains themes of sexual assault and domestic violence.

title.children: Domestic and sexual violence victims hopeful for change as royal commission findings set to be released

image.altText: Two Australian $100 bills, the top being genuine and the bottom a counterfeit that reads "copy" in the top right corner.

props.synopsis: Genuine Australian bank notes have security features like hidden images and fluorescent ink, and return to shape after being scrunched.

title.children: Counterfeit cash is circulating. Here's how to spot a fake note

image.altText: Close up of a collection of jagged red rocks. In the background, two towers spitting flames.

props.synopsis: In May, the WA government released a report from an ongoing study into the impacts of industrial air emissions on ancient rock carvings, but new emails obtained by FOI have raised questions about the government's role in the scientific report.

title.children: Emails raise new questions about state government's role in scientific report

image.altText: A man with long white hair and a large white beard sits on a bench in a park. He has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A growing coalition of groups who reject the legitimacy of governments and courts are engaged in what some call a "quasi-civil war".

title.children: The growing movement challenging the authority of courts, councils and cops

image.altText: Matt Wright has brown hair and is wearing a button-up shirt as he walks towards the court.

props.synopsis: Australia's aviation regulator has launched a counter-claim against Matt Wright, arguing the TV star should pay any damages awarded to the widow of the man killed in a 2022 chopper crash.

title.children: Cross-claim launched against Matt Wright over fatal chopper crash

image.altText: Surfer in black wetsuit holds up board with large shark bite.

props.synopsis: A surfer sitting on his board was attacked early this morning on the New South Wales north coast.

title.children: 5m shark caught and released at scene of surfer's 'miracle' escape

image.altText: a woman sitting in front of a computer desk

props.synopsis: Working from home may become the presumed status of Australia's white-collar workforce as part of a new push from the Australian Services Union.

title.children: The ASU is pushing for presumed work from home. Here's what that means

image.altText: Putin smiles as he shakes Trump's hand, while Trump looks a little sheepish.

props.synopsis: Beyond the optics, Donald Trump handed Vladimir Putin a number of other wins that will shore up his support at home and reinforce to the world that US-Russia relations have been normalised.

title.children: Putin got the red-carpet treatment from Trump. Where does this leave Ukraine?

image.altText: Homelessness epidemic

props.synopsis: A military court has found a New Zealand soldier guilty of attempted espionage for a foreign power — the first spying conviction in the country's history.

title.children: Military court finds New Zealand soldier guilty of attempted espionage

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in parliament points his hand at the Opposition Leader.

props.synopsis: Delulu's addition — derived from the word delusional — cites an example used by the prime minister in the lead up to the election.

title.children: Anthony Albanese gets a shout out as 'delulu' enters the Cambridge Dictionary

image.altText: A view of a National Australia Bank logo in Sydney

props.synopsis: The bank's payroll review and remediation is ongoing, and total costs remain uncertain, according to NAB's latest ASX release.

title.children: NAB flags $130 million hit after underpaying staff, as payroll problems widen

image.altText: Vector illustration featuring robotic arms above two human figures working at conveyor belt lined with boxes.

props.synopsis: Experts share 23 bold, surprising and thought-provoking ideas to boost Australia's productivity growth — and improve living standards.

title.children: Boosting Australia's struggling productivity needs bold ideas. Here are 23 of them

image.altText: An artist impression of a proposed conversion of Carnarvon Golf Course in Lidcombe into a new memorial park

props.synopsis: A government plan to convert a Sydney golf course into a cemetery will be presented to residents on Tuesday, amid claims the decision was made "a long time ago".

title.children: Plan to convert Sydney golf course into cemetery 'short-sighted', MP says

props.synopsis: Moana Hope details the "vile and disgusting" verbal abuse she was on the receiving end of at a local football game over the weekend.

title.children: Former AFLW star details 'vile and disgusting' abuse at local footy game

image.altText: A woman shirtless standing near a fence with bras with her arms wide open and a smile on her face

image.altText: Dr Vahid Reza Adib

props.synopsis: Rosemarie Campbell died in 2022 after a gastric bypass surgery performed by Dr Reza Adib, the partner of former Queensland premier Annastacia Palaszczuk.

title.children: Former premier's partner questioned over patient's death after surgery

image.altText: Passengers line up for security screening at the airport.

props.synopsis: International travel has been in the spotlight recently, with nerve-wracking tales of border crackdowns in the US and unexpected detentions. Here's what your passport reveals about you when you're travelling.

title.children: Think your passport is just ID? Here's what border officials really know about you
